last_post.content:

UPDATE: https://whomtofollow.com/ and https://followgraph.vercel.app/ are what I was looking for, thanks!

title: The DAIR Institute

last_post.content:
"Such language that inflates the capabilities of automated systems and anthropomorphizes them … deceives people into thinking that there is a sentient being behind the synthetic media. This not only lures people into uncritically trusting the outputs of systems like ChatGPT, but also misattributes agency. Accountability properly lies not with the artifacts but with their builders"

https://www.dair-institute.org/blog/letter-statement-March2023

title: GitHub - veekaybee/awesome-twitter-algo: The release of the Twitter algorithm, annotated for recsys

last_post.content:
The Twitter algorithm dropped yesterday, and now it’s time to reverse-engineer. @igor and I are starting to make sense of what’s actually been released, how it compares to what the prod codebase might be and giving the released code some context.

If you know #search, #recsys, or #engineering and want to contribute to make what’s been released actually consumable for public understanding, please join us, contributions welcome.

https://github.com/veekaybee/awesome-twitter-algo

title: Fiction vs Reality: My Texts with Michael Shellenberger

last_post.content:
People say a lot of crazy things on the internet; I usually ignore it. But today, after nearly a full month of being smeared by Twitter Files writer Michael Shellenberger, including in sworn Congressional testimony, I’m releasing some files of my own: our WhatsApp texts, email conversation, and an interview that he did of me but never published.

https://reneediresta.substack.com/p/fiction-vs-reality-my-texts-with

title: https://ramblingreaders.org

last_post.content: Do you know there's a #fediverse alternative to Amazon-owned #Goodreads? #BookWyrm is a social network for tracking your reading, writing reviews, and discovering what to read next. You can follow and interact with users on different #BookWyrm instances and on #Mastodon. You can import from a Goodreads CSV export. You can create private shelves and curated lists. Join us at https://ramblingreaders.org or choose one of the other instances available #books #reading  #bookstodon @bookstodon

title: Stanford CRFM

last_post.content:
Training language models using pre-trained LLMs to lower cost and size.

#Alpaca: A Strong, Replicable Instruction-Following Model: “We are releasing our findings about an instruction-following language model, dubbed Alpaca, which is fine-tuned from Meta’s LLaMA 7B model. We train the Alpaca model on 52K instruction-following demonstrations generated in the style of self-instruct using text-davinci-003. On the self-instruct evaluation set, Alpaca shows many behaviors similar to OpenAI’s text-davinci-003, but is also surprisingly small and easy/cheap to reproduce”

#Alpaca / #LLM / #stanford #ai <https://crfm.stanford.edu/2023/03/13/alpaca.html> / <https://arxiv.org/abs/2212.10560>

title: AI-enhanced development makes me more ambitious with my projects

last_post.content: This is another example of how ChatGPT et al are making me more ambitious in my projects: normally I would have got as far as "we could video it and then split the video up into frames every 10s and run OCR..." - and then given up on the project, because figuring out how to do that would take longer than just sitting next to the thermometer and writing the measurements down by hand https://simonwillison.net/2023/Mar/27/ai-enhanced-development/

The Green Dragontail Butterfly (Lamproptera meges) is a species of swallowtail butterfly found across Southeast Asia. The butterfly is known for its long, white-tipped tail, transparent forewings, and its quick and erratic flight patterns.

title: Six Centuries of Type & Printing (letterpress and ebook bundle)

last_post.content: Back in 2020, I published Six Centuries of Type & Printing, a concise book – 64 pages – that actually starts centuries before Gutenberg, with Chinese and Korea printing, and then digs into 1450 to 2020, covering ~600 years of technological advances. Set in hot-metal type (Monotype Bembo) in North Yorkshire, printed in London, and bound in Germany with a foil-stamped cover & slipcase, I still have copies available for shipping worldwide! https://glog.glennf.com/tiny-type-museum-time-capsule-and-more/six-centuries-letterpress (ebook edition available)

title: https://transit.alerts.social

last_post.content:
I'm making an ActivityPub server for distributing transit alerts 🎉 The tool is completely open-source and fetches alerts from GTFS-realtime Service Alerts feeds

Official instance: https://transit.alerts.social
Currently works with:
@kingcountymetro
@commtrans
@soundtransit

I expect to add a lot more agencies to the instance in the near-ish future—want to validate more before going wider

GitHub: https://github.com/kona314/transit-fedilerts

#GTFS #GTFSrealtime #ActivityPub #fediverse #transit

title: ENH Adds TargetEncoder by thomasjpfan · Pull Request #25334 · scikit-learn/scikit-learn

last_post.content:
The TargetEncoder PR has been merged into the scikit-learn main branch!

https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/pull/25334

It's a very efficient way to deal with high cardinality categorical variables for supervised machine learning tasks. See the following quick tutorial to compare its performance with one-hot encoding, ordinal encoding and native support of categorical variables in Gradient Boosted Trees:

https://scikit-learn.org/dev/auto_examples/preprocessing/plot_target_encoder.html

It will be part of scikit-learn 1.3.

#sklearn #PyData #SciPy #MachineLearnig #Python

last_post.content:
https://pluralistic.net/2023/03/28/imagine-a-horse/

By @pluralistic

“If you're keeping score on "free markets" based on who gets how much money, or how much inequality they produce, you're committing the sin of caring about "distributional effects."

Smart “economismists” care about the size of the pie, not who gets which slice. Unsurprisingly, the greatest advocates for economism are the people to whom this philosophy allocates the biggest slices.”

title: Fediverse Developer Network

last_post.content:
Gabe Kangas, of ownCast, is hosting a first meeting on how to pool and streamline developer documentation for building interoperable-out-of-the-box #Fediverse apps, maybe leading to a "Fediverse Developer Network" or such in the future.

We had a session about this at #Fediforum this week, and there was a lot of enthusiasm about it. If you have documentation, would like better documentation and perhaps mentor support when implementing #ActivityPub and related, join us?

My 1st @joss pub too!

https://github.com/pyOpenSci/software-submission/issues/68

If you use tools like Audacity, Praat or Raven to annotate bioacoustics/speech data and you've been wanting to work with the annotations in #Python, it just got a lot easier!

last_post.content:
Really excited to attend #JupyterCon in Paris next month!

Vincent Maladiere and I will give a full day tutorial on predictive Survival Analysis and Competing Risks modeling with a Gradient Boosting model assembled from generic scikit-learn building blocks. We will also introduce many concepts and model evaluation methodology using specialized libraries such as lifelines and scikit-survival.

Here is the full agenda for this session:

title: Jerzy Neyman: A Positive Role Model in the History of Frequentist Statistics

last_post.content: The approach to statistics that underlies most knowledge claims in science, the Neyman-Pearson approach to statistical inferences, was invented by Jerzy Neyman, who was not just an excellent statistician, but also an excellent human being: http://daniellakens.blogspot.com/2021/09/jerzy-neyman-positive-role-model-in.html

title: The Bucha massacre: mapping a year of Kremlin denial - EUvsDisinfo

last_post.content:
We will always remember the haunting images of Ukrainian citizens killed in executions in Bucha.

As their bodies were discovered, the Kremlin began denying, blaming others, confusing and lying about the truth. They failed.

Multiple investigations – including a detailed UN report – have established Russian culpability.

On #FactcheckingDay, we reaffirm our commitment to countering disinformation by setting the records straight.

Discover how ➡ https://euvsdisinfo.eu/the-bucha-massacre-mapping-a-year-of-kremlin-denial/

title: Publishers beat Internet Archive as judge rules e-book lending violates copyright

last_post.content:
"Publishers beat Internet Archive as judge rules e-book lending violates copyright

Internet Archive: Judge’s copyright ruling is a “blow to all libraries.”"

The Internet Archive kept many books and media lost to time alive for us. So many pieces of lost media, including vintage films, books someone uploaded from their personal collection, political news that got scrubbed off the world, to name a few.

But alas, this is the gardening company deciding to burn down the seed vaults because nobody will buy their packaged seeds.

By the way, if they believed they could get away with it, they would definitely try to outlaw physical libraries as well.

#InternetArchive #bookpublishers #CopyrightInfringement #DigitalLending #ebooks #libraries

🔗: https://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2023/03/publishers-beat-internet-archive-as-judge-rules-e-book-lending-violates-copyright/

title: Information on RFC 9402 » RFC Editor

last_post.content:
"Cat pictures and videos are often shared across the Internet. Many of these files display feline subjects interacting with boxes and other containers.

Since there is currently no compact notation for describing such media, this document details a standard notation to describe the position and interaction of cats, containers, and related subjects pictured in these images."

RFC 9402: Concat Notation
https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc9402

title: tandfonline.com/doi/epdf/10.10...

last_post.content:
Research Article
Knitted origami
Elizabeth L. Wilmer

"Techniques are presented for embedding horizontal, vertical, and45◦diagonal crease lines into garter stitch knitted fabric. While theseare mostly based on standard lace knitting stitches, the horizon-tal creases use double-cable-crossed elongated stitches in a non-standard way. This crease library suffices to knit a model of a squaretwist, a foundational origami tessellation unit."

https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/epdf/10.1080/17513472.2023.2191572

title: iffybooks.net/event/solar-chat...

last_post.content:
We're looking for help to build a wireless, solar-powered chat network across the Philly area! Are you interested in learning about off-grid solar power? Do you have a sunny place on your roof, in your yard, or near an upstairs window where you can leave a small radio transceiver? This workshop may be for you!

Each participant will receive a free kit with all the parts needed to build a solar-powered LoRa radio node. You'll assemble the kit, mount it in a weatherproof enclosure (provided by you), and use the Meshtastic app to start sending encrypted text messages.

Registration opens Monday, April 3rd at 8:30 p.m. You can sign up on our site:
https://iffybooks.net/event/solar-chat-network

Supplies for this workshop are provided by a grant from the Engaged Humanities Studio at Swarthmore College. Many thanks to @pixouls for helping plan the event!

title: Orion Magazine - Geography as Generosity: An Afternoon with Barry Lopez

last_post.content:
"Good place-language, well used, opens onto mystery, grows knowledge, and summons wonder. And in the absence of an exact and detail-giving lexis, the living world can blur into a generalized wash of green, becoming an easily disposable backdrop. Certainly, the nuances observed by specialized vocabularies of place-perception are evaporating from common usage, burnt off by capital, apathy, and virtualization.

https://orionmagazine.org/article/barry-lopez-from-here-to-the-horizon/

title: ~this week in security~ | creating a free weekly cybersecurity newsletter | Patreon

last_post.content:
~this week in security~ goes out to about 12,000 weekly subscribers (with no tracking!). It costs me hundreds of dollars a month to send out. As a working journalist, I don't accept ads or sponsors for my weekly newsletter, so donations from readers help to keep the costs down.

Please consider supporting! https://www.patreon.com/thisweekinsecurity
